meanings.definition: To mix a solid substance with a liquid until it forms a solution.
meanings.sent1: I dissolve sugar in my tea to make it sweet.
meanings.sent2: She likes to dissolve salt in water for her science experiment.
meanings.sent3: The magic potion will dissolve the curse on the princess.
meanings.sent4: His smile seemed to dissolve all the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The music seemed to dissolve all my worries away.

meanings.definition: To disappear or cause something to disappear gradually.
meanings.sent1: The sugar will dissolve slowly in the hot coffee.
meanings.sent2: The mist will dissolve as the sun rises higher in the sky.
meanings.sent3: The mystery surrounding the old house began to dissolve with each clue found.
meanings.sent4: Her doubts started to dissolve like sugar in warm water.
meanings.sent5: The fear in his eyes seemed to dissolve into determination.

meanings.definition: To bring to an end or terminate.
meanings.sent1: The meeting will dissolve once all the issues are resolved.
meanings.sent2: The contract will dissolve after the agreed-upon period.
meanings.sent3: The argument between the siblings dissolved into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The sunset marked the moment when day dissolved into night.
meanings.sent5: The final note of the song seemed to dissolve into the silence of the room.
